The lime deposit or " fur " is a poor conductor of heat, and it is therefore most detrimental to the efficiency of the system to allow the interior of the boiler or any other portion to become furred up. Further, if not removed, the fur will in a short time bring about a fracture in the boiler.

We have here the interesting fact that a muscle (portion of the triceps humeri of the reptiles) has been reduced to a tendon, which in a secondary way has become connected with cutaneous muscles, which, when strongly developed, represent its belly.

In the Steganopodes they tend to become much reduced, e.g.

in cormorants (Phalacrocoracidae), and especially in Sula, where the nasal slits become completely closed up, and the greater portion of the nasal cavity is also abolished, being restricted to the olfactory region with its unusually wide choanae.
definition: To be appropriate or suitable to: “It would not become me … to interfere with parties” ( Jonathan Swift )
To show to advantage; look good with: The new suit becomes you.

William Shakespeare (1564-1616)
But, madam, where is Warwick then become?
(copulative) To come about; happen; come into being; arise; begin to be; turn into. [from 12th c.]
To be proper for; to befit. [from 13th c.]

Of an adornment, piece of clothing etc.: to look attractive on (someone). [from 14th c.]
That dress really becomes you.
